## Code annotations

``` r
library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
penguins |>                                      # <1>
  mutate(                                        # <2>
    bill_ratio = bill_depth_mm / bill_length_mm, # <2>
    bill_area  = bill_depth_mm * bill_length_mm  # <2>
  )                                              # <2>
```

1.  Take `penguins`, and then,
2.  add new columns for the bill ratio and bill area.

## Callout Blocks

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-note callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Note</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

Note that there are five types of callouts, including: `note`,`tip`, `warning`,
`caution` and `important`.

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-warning callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Warning</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

Callouts provide a simple way to attract attention, for example, to this
warning.

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-important callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Important</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

The callout heading is provided by the callout type, with the expected heading
(i.e., Note, Warning, Important, Tip, or Caution).

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-tip callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Tip With Title</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

This is an example of a callout with a title. Providing a callout heading is
optional.

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-caution callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Caution</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

This is an example of a caution.

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-simple callout-note callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill">Simple</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```

A simple callout.

```{=html}
</div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<div class="callout callout-style-default callout-note no-icon callout-titled">
<div class="callout-header d-flex align-content-center">
<div class="callout-icon-container"><i class="callout-icon no-icon"></i></div>
<div class="callout-title-container flex-fill"><span class="screen-reader-only">Note</span>No Icon</div>
</div>
<div class="callout-body-container callout-body">
```
